text:
Duane Park, on Duane Street, west of its intersection with Hudson Street. Across the Park appears the east side of Hudson Street, north from and including Thomas, to Worth Street. The Western Union Building stands to-day on this site, which in this view comprises the three R.C. Williams & Co. Buildings.

October 25, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

Hudson Street, east side, south from but not including Duane Street to West Broadway, showing the Chambers Street station of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line at Chambers Street and West Broadway (where Hudson Street terminates). It is a point of confluence for Hudson, Chambers Streets and West Broadway. Across the elevated structure is seen the 6-story Cosmopolitan Hotel, at the N.E. corner of West Broadway and Chambers Street. In the background appears the Woolworth and Transportation Buildings.

July 2, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Hudson Street, west side, from and including Duane (left), to and including Jay (right) Streets. The 5-story house, (at the extreme right) is the U.S. Marine Hospital at the N.W. corner of Jay Street. Also shown (background) is the Hudson River and the New Jersey shore.

August 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
